Description: A necklace: composed of some shell disc beads and very many short cylindrical beads of horn and of black with some grey steatite. Most of the beads are of uniform diameter.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 472B Found at the neck of a male
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 35; pl.XXII, 43; Grave register, pl.VIII; Bead corpus, pl.XXXIX, 86F33.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (46)
